title: How to Use Flaky Sea Salt

steps.headline: Look for certain qualities in flaky salt:
steps.description: Crisp crunch Gentle, mild, sweet flavour Avoid flaky salt that tastes bitter or too reminiscent of the sea

steps.headline: Add to salads.
steps.description: Pour a little flaky sea salt over the top of a salad as both a garnish and final seasoning. It makes the salad really come to life.

steps.headline: Use as a crust on meats and fish.
steps.description: Coat as normal with oil, butter or water and add flaky sea salt.

steps.headline: Add to phyllo (filo) pastry dishes.
steps.description: Make sure to coat the pastry in olive oil first before sprinkling on a little flaky sea salt prior to baking.

steps.headline: Use in baking and desserts.
steps.description: Where salt is called for, use flaky salt in place of ordinary salt. It is not at all unusual for chefs to be adding the salt as a garnish, liberally sprinkling salt over ice cream, mousse etc.
